item.title: 飞机租赁商 DAE 认为中国商飞打破了空客和波音的双头垄断局面
item.description: 迪拜航空航天企业（DAE）飞机租赁公司负责人告诉路透社，中国国有飞机制造商中国商飞有机会在未来十年打破空客和波音对客机市场的双头垄断。【原文：Chinese state-owned planemaker COMAC has the opportunity to break Airbus and Boeing's duopoly of the passenger jet market over the next decade, the chief of aircraft leasing company Dubai Aerospace Enterprise (DAE) told Reuters.】

item.title: 现金再次流出中国，对人民币构成压力
item.description: 人民币汇率下滑，大量现金从内地流向香港，这表明中国国内投资者正在放弃对国内市场立即复苏的预期，转而投向最接近的高收益资产。【原文：A sliding yuan and extensive outflows of cash from the mainland into Hong Kong show China's domestic investors are shelving expectations for any immediate recovery in their home markets and fleeing to the closest better-yielding assets.】

item.title: 日本央行副行长内田表示准备进一步提高利率
item.description: 日本央行副行长内田伸一周五表示，如果经济和物价走势符合其预测，央行将 "调整货币支持程度"，这表明央行已做好进一步加息的准备。【原文：Bank of Japan Deputy Governor Shinichi Uchida said on Friday the central bank will "adjust the degree of monetary support" if the economy and prices move in line with its forecasts, signalling readiness to raise interest rates further.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：中国要求维萨卡和万事达卡削减交易费
item.description: 彭博新闻社援引一位熟知内情的人士的话报道称，中国正在推动威士卡和万事达卡降低在中国的银行卡交易费，作为方便外国游客支付的努力的一部分。【原文：China is pushing for Visa and Mastercard to lower their bank card transaction fees in the country, as part of an effort to facilitate payments for foreign visitors, Bloomberg News reported, citing a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 贝莱德不会参与马来西亚机场私有化，GIP 表示
item.description: 全球基础设施伙伴公司（GIP）表示，在穆斯林占多数的马来西亚，美国贝莱德（BlackRock）公司因被指与以色列有联系而受到批评，因此该公司的买家贝莱德将不会参与马来西亚机场的私有化。【原文：Global Infrastructure Partners (GIP) said its buyer BlackRock will not be involved in privatising Malaysia Airports after criticism in Muslim-majority Malaysia over the U.S. firm's alleged ties to Israel.】

item.title: 欧洲太阳能发电激增冲击价格，暴露储能需求
item.description: 由于太阳能发电量激增导致供需不匹配，欧洲今年出现负电价的小时数达到创纪录水平，这可能有助于将投资转向急需的储能解决方案。【原文：Europe has clocked a record number of hours of negative power prices this year due to a mismatch between demand and supply as solar power generation soars, potentially helping to shift investment to much needed storage solutions.】

item.title: 英伟达的惊人涨幅让投资者纠结是套现还是买进更多
item.description: 英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp）股价的大幅上涨让投资者开始权衡是要套现、继续持有以获取更多收益，还是追逐这只在过去一年里涨了三倍的股票。【原文：The huge rally in Nvidia Corp's shares has investors weighing whether to cash in, hold on for more gains or chase a stock that has tripled during the past year.】

item.title: 工党执政时期以消费者为中心的贷款可能会削弱英国银行的利润
item.description: 英国工党曾一度被视为敌视银行的政党，近年来，工党在试图夺取政权的过程中一直在向贷款机构示好，但如果工党在下月的大选中获胜，预计工党的一些政策仍将打击银行业的利润。【原文：Once seen as hostile to banks, Britain's Labour has courted lenders in recent years as it attempts to gain power, yet some of the left-leaning party's policies are still expected to hit the sector's profits if it wins next month's election.】

item.title: 摩根大通财富主管认为中国经济前景向好
item.description: 摩根大通资产与财富管理部首席执行官玛丽-厄尔多斯（Mary Erdoes）表示，摩根大通看到了中国经济改善的迹象，这将促进该行在中国的业务发展。【原文：JPMorgan Chase is seeing signs of an improving economy in China that will bolster the bank's business in the country after a sluggish period, its CEO of asset and wealth management Mary Erdoes said.】

item.title: 欧洲 美元由爪子最锋利的鸽子支持
item.description: 凯文-巴克兰对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Kevin Buckland】

item.title: 德国不指望通过中国之行解决欧盟关税紧张问题
item.description: 在欧盟威胁要对中国汽车征收高额关税之后，德国经济部长罗伯特-哈贝克在访华之旅中并不期望就贸易紧张局势达成解决方案。【原文：In his trip to China, Germany's Economy Minister Robert Habeck doesn't expect to reach a solution on trade tensions after the EU threatened to impose steep tariffs on Chinese cars.】

item.title: 瑞银称亚洲对冲基金对中国的押注超过全球同行
item.description: 亚洲对冲基金在 5 月份和前 5 个月领涨全球，原因是对该地区股票的看涨情绪和在中国的获胜头寸提振了业绩。【原文：Asian hedge funds led global gains in May and the first five months, as bullish sentiment towards regional equities and winning positions in China boosted performance.】

item.title: 本周亚洲股市低迷，日元走势艰难
item.description: 本周早些时候，亚洲股市一度反弹至 26 个月高点，但随后出现获利回吐。【原文：Asian shares are ending the week with a whimper after a rally to 26-month highs earlier this week drew profit-taking, while the strength in the U.S. dollar as central banks in Europe cut rates kept pressuring the yen towards the intervention zone.】

item.title: 软银首席执行官大谈人工超级智能的雄心壮志
item.description: 软银集团首席执行官孙正义周五表示，该集团的使命是通过实现人工超级智能来帮助人类进步。【原文：SoftBank Group CEO Masayoshi Son said on Friday that the group's mission was to help in humanity's progress by realising artificial super intelligence, which he said would exceed human capabilities by a factor of 10,000.】

item.title: 其他央行比美联储更鸽派，美元刷新多周高点
item.description: 周五，美元兑英镑汇率升至159日元上方，创下八周新高，并接近五周高点，美联储耐心的降息态度与其他地区更为鸽派的立场形成了鲜明对比。【原文：The U.S. dollar pushed to a fresh eight-week top above 159 yen and clung close to a five-week peak to sterling on Friday, with the Federal Reserve's patient approach to cutting interest rates contrasting with more dovish stances elsewhere.】

item.title: 巴西法官结束对谷歌和 Telegram 的协调调查
item.description: 巴西最高法院的一名法官周四决定结束对 Alphabet 旗下谷歌和 Telegram 的调查，因为这两家公司涉嫌协调反对一项旨在打击假新闻的法案。【原文：A judge on Brazil's top court decided on Thursday to close an investigation into Alphabet's Google and Telegram for allegedly coordinating their opposition to a bill aimed at cracking down on fake news.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局调查俄克拉荷马市附近低空飞行的西南航空公司航班
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局（FAA）周四表示，正在调查西南航空公司一架从俄克拉荷马市机场下降到 9 英里（14.5 公里）低空的航班。【原文：The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) said on Thursday it is investigating a Southwest Airlines flight that descended to a low altitude 9 miles (14.5 km) from the Oklahoma City airport.】

item.title: 加息忧虑成为焦点，油价下滑
item.description: 周五早盘，原油期货价格下滑，原因是亚洲和美国的利率可能会长期走高，而美国石油库存的下降使得油价没有走低。【原文：Crude oil futures slid in early trade on Friday on the prospect of higher-for-longer interest rates in Asia and the United States, while falling U.S. oil inventories kept prices from moving lower.】

item.title: 日本 6 月工厂活动因成本上升而放缓，PMI 显示
item.description: 周五进行的一项商业调查显示，6 月份日本工厂活动连续第二个月出现扩张，但由于订单减少和成本压力加大，增长速度有所放缓。【原文：Japan's factory activity expanded for a second straight month in June but the pace of growth eased as orders weakened and cost pressures intensified, a business survey showed on Friday.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：美国监管机构拒绝花旗的 "生前遗嘱 "决议计划
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周四报道，美国银行业监管机构拒绝了花旗集团所谓的 "生前遗嘱"，该遗嘱是花旗集团在发生灾难性倒闭时进行清盘的详细计划。【原文：U.S. banking regulators rejected Citigroup's so-called "living will", which is a detailed plan to wind itself down in the event of catastrophic failure, The Financial Times reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国航空公司空乘人员准备罢工
item.description: 代表美国航空集团空乘人员的工会周四表示，在本周与航空公司的合同谈判未能达成协议后，他们正准备举行罢工。【原文：A union representing flight attendants for American Airlines Group said on Thursday they are preparing to strike after contract negotiations with the carrier failed to produce an agreement this week.】

item.title: 日元汇率下滑，日本对日元熊市发出新警告
item.description: 日本最高货币外交官神田正人（Masato Kanda）周五表示，日本当局已准备好对货币市场上损害经济的投机和过度波动行为采取行动。【原文：Japanese authorities are ready to take action against speculative and excessively volatile moves in the currency market that hurt the economy, the country's top currency diplomat Masato Kanda said on Friday.】

item.title: 巴西收紧能源分配特许权续约规则
item.description: 巴西政府周四发布了更严格的能源分销合同延期准则，放宽了提前取消特许权的限制，并允许巴西限制不遵守规则的公司的赔付。【原文：The Brazilian government issued on Thursday tighter guidelines for the extension of energy distribution contracts, easing the advanced cancellation of concessions and allowing the country to limit pay out from firms that do not comply with the rules.】

item.title: 日本需求拉动型通胀放缓，为日本央行加息之路蒙上阴影
item.description: 周五的数据显示，由于能源税的影响，日本5月份的核心通胀率加速上升，但剔除燃料影响的指数连续第九个月放缓，这使得央行决定何时加息变得更加复杂。【原文：Japan's core inflation accelerated in May due to energy levies but an index that strips away the effect of fuel slowed for the ninth straight month, data showed on Friday, complicating the central bank's decision on how soon to raise interest rates.】

item.title: 加州将对通用汽车旗下 Cruise 公司拖延旧金山事故报告处以罚款
item.description: 加利福尼亚州监管机构周四表示，将对通用汽车公司的 Cruise 部门处以可能的最高处罚，因为该部门未能及时向委员会提供有关去年涉及其一辆自动驾驶汽车事故的完整信息。【原文：A California regulator said on Thursday it is imposing the maximum penalty possible on General Motors' Cruise unit for its failure to promptly provide complete information to the commission about an accident involving one of its self-driving vehicles last year.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，美国司法部撤销了 TikTok 在诉讼中误导美国消费者的指控
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四报道，美国司法部将不会追究 TikTok 在即将提起的指控该公司侵犯儿童隐私权的诉讼中在数据安全方面误导美国消费者的指控。【原文：The U.S. Department of Justice will not pursue allegations that TikTok misled U.S. consumers about their data security in a forthcoming suit accusing the company of children's privacy violations, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 早间竞价关注日本通胀；日元和人民币下滑
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 埃克森-赫斯仲裁小组未完成工作，赫斯出售给雪佛龙的交易停滞不前
item.description: 埃克森美孚（Exxon Mobil）是否对赫斯公司在圭亚那的业务拥有优先购买权的问题迟迟得不到裁决。【原文：A contract arbitration panel that could block or green-light the $53 billion sale of Hess Corp to Chevron remains incomplete three months after the case was filed, stalling a decision on whether Exxon Mobil has a right of first refusal over Hess' Guyana operations.】

item.title: Unite Here 工会选出 130 年历史上首位女主席
item.description: 工会 Unite Here 周四选出了其 130 年历史上的第一位女主席，2024 年对于这个代表着全美和加拿大 27.5 万名工人（其中大多数是女性）的工会来说是重要的一年。【原文：Labor union Unite Here on Thursday elected its first female president in its 130-year history, as 2024 shapes up to be an important year for the union representing 275,000 workers, a majority of whom are women, across the United States and Canada.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，经过数月谈判，波音即将与供应商 Spirit Aero 达成协议
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士周四表示，波音公司正在接近达成回购精神航空系统公司（Spirit AeroSystems）的协议，此前该公司的前子公司与空中客车公司（Airbus）就跨大西洋拆分这家陷入困境的供应商的单独谈判取得了实质性进展。【原文：Boeing is nearing a deal to buy back Spirit AeroSystems after its former subsidiary made substantial progress in separate talks with Airbus over a transatlantic breakup of the struggling supplier, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.】
